section.title: Creating a New Document Template
section.p:
To create your own custom document template and have it appear in the new file wizard, follow these steps:
Create a new file (whatever type of document you need) and customize it to become a starting point for creating new files of this type.You can use editor variables in the template file content and they will be expanded when the files are opened.
Save the new file template in one of the following locations:
The templates directory in the installation directory (/templates).
You can also use any other directory of your choice, but you must add that directory to the list of templates in the Document Templates Preferences page. The name that you use to save the template will be the name that appears in the new file wizard, including capitalization, space, and characters (for example, My Custom Template1.xml will appear in the new file wizard as My Custom Template1).
Open the new file wizard ( File New
File New New from Templates ) and you should see your custom template in the appropriate folder. For DITA templates, they will also appear in the dialog box for creating new DITA topics from the DITA Maps Manager, but if you create a corresponding properties file (see the procedure below), you need to set the type property to dita.

section.title: Customizing the Icons for a Custom Document Template
section.p:
If you want to customize the icons to be used for your custom document templates, create a properties file to specify the icons using the following procedure:
Create a properties file using the same name as your custom template file except with a .properties extension (for example, My Custom Template.properties). This properties file will specify the icons that will be used in the new file wizard and a type property. You can use one of the .properties files in the templates directory to get started.
The properties file should look like this (for all types of templates other than DITA):smallIcon=../icons/Article_16.png bigIcon=../icons/Article_48.png type=general
For DITA templates, it will look like this:smallIcon=../icons/Topic_16.png bigIcon=../icons/Topic_48.png type=ditaIf you chose to use a custom directory for the new template (in step 2 of the new template procedure), make sure the path to the icons is relative to that directory.
For DITA files, the type property needs to be set to dita. Otherwise, the template will not appear in the dialog box for creating new DITA topics from the DITA Maps Manager. For all other types of files, set it to general. The icons specified in this properties file will only be used for the new file wizards and not any other part of the interface.
Save the properties file in the same directory where you saved your new file template (in step 2 of the new template procedure).
Open the new file wizard ( File New
File New New from Templates ) and you should see your custom template in the appropriate folder with the customized icon.

section.title: Add a Prefix or Suffix to File Names for a Custom Document Template
section.p:
You can use a properties file for each custom document template to add a prefix or suffix to the file name that is proposed in certain dialog boxes when you create a new file from that template. This applies to the following new document dialog boxes:
The new document dialog box that appears when you select New File from the contextual menu in the Project view. The prefix or suffix is added to the name of the file in the File name field.
The new document dialog box that appears when you select New New from Templates [Template Name] Next from the contextual menu in the Navigator view. The prefix or suffix is added to the name of the file in the File field.
For DITA files, it also applies to the new document dialog box that appears when you select Append Child New or Insert After New from the DITA Maps Manager. The prefix or suffix is added to the name of the file in the Save as field.

To add a prefix or suffix to the file names for a custom document template, follow these steps:
Create a properties file using the same name as your custom template file except with a .properties extension (for example, My Custom Template.properties). You can use this properties file to specify filenamePrefix and filenameSuffix properties that will be used in the new file wizard. You can use one of the .properties files in the templates directory to get started.
The properties file should look something like this (for all types of templates other than DITA):type=general filenamePrefix=prod_ filenameSuffix=_test
For DITA templates, it will look something like this:type=dita filenamePrefix=prod_ filenameSuffix=_test
For DITA files, the type property needs to be set to dita. For all other types of files, set it to general.
Save the properties file in the same directory where you saved your new file template (in step 2 of the new template procedure).
Open the new document wizard (using the methods described above) and when you select your custom template, you should see your prefix or suffix in the file name that is proposed in that dialog box.
